oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Effect of clenbuterol on acetylcholine induced dyspnoea in calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nuytten, J.
Muylle, E.
Oyaert, W.
Van Den Hende, C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Acetylcholine
Adrenergic receptors
Bronchopneumonia
cattle diseases
Clenbuterol
Respiratory diseases
Sympathomimetics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Respiratory diseases are very common in calves and cause considerable economic losses. Curative therapy consists mainly in the administration of antibiotics and antiinflammatory drugs. Broncholytic drugs such as beta-2-sympathetic agents were until now only occasionally used in calves. In horses these drugs are currently used in the treatment of COPD and acute bronchopneumonia (3). The aim of this experiment was to evaluate the effect of clenbuterol, (Ventipulmin Boehringer), a beta-2-sympathetic drum on the acetylcholine-induced dyspnoea in calves.
